BJsbkqNSq.description: Upload/download same/different frequency. 1 = same frequency mode; 2 = different frequency mode.
BJsbkqNSq.label: Mode

@/join-network.description: Join network. Initiate over the air authentication (OTAA).

@/02-example-msg.description: Demonstration of sending a message. Run in debug mode to change the message at runtime.

HkZrOoSWu9.description: Output true if joined to network.
HkZrOoSWu9.label: Joined

@/joined-network.description: Check if device has joined network.

HJ4HxZ3Bh.content:
*Set maximum size of payload*. The data for each sensor are prefixed by two bytes:
* *Data Channel*: Uniquely identifies each sensor in the device across frames
* *Data Type*: Identifies the data type in the frame, eg. “temperature”.

Two bytes are required for each of our measurements (temperature and barometric pressure), making a total payload size of eight bytes.

For information on the size of other datatypes, please see: https://docs.mydevices.com/docs/lorawan/cayenne-lpp

rJiBlZ3r3.content: Sets interval between measurements. For testing this has been set to just 30 seconds. In normal use the interval would be much larger (many minutes to hours).

SyEIgb3B2.content: Convert measurement from pascals to hectopascals.

BJ9Igb3S3.content: *add-temperature* and *add-barometric-pressure* build up the payload. Each measurement must be assigned its own channel.

B1CLgb2Bn.content: *CFM* (confirmation of uplink) set to *True* here for testing. However, in normal use, confirmation of uplinks should be avoided: https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/docs/lorawan/limitations/#sending-responses-from-your-application-to-your-node-downlink

HJzwe-2Hh.content: Empty the payload buffer so that it is ready for new measurements.

@/01-example-lpp.description: Demonstration of sending data using the Cayenne Low Power Payload (https://docs.mydevices.com/docs/lorawan/cayenne-lpp).

ryMnJ7YHn.description: Upload/download same/different frequency. 1 = same frequency mode; 2 = different frequency mode.
ryMnJ7YHn.label: Mode

S1O2JmtS2.description: Set class. Options: 0 (A), 1 (B) and 2 (C). See: https://www.thethingsnetwork.org/doc
S1O2JmtS2.label: Class

@/save-mac-configuration.description: Save MAC configuration parameters into EEPROM/FLASH.

@/restore-mac-defaults.description: Restore MAC default parameters in EEPROM/FLASH.

@/send-lpp.description: Send low power payload (LPP). See: https://xod.io/libs/wayland/cayenne-lpp/

@/send-message.description: Send message. For most applications it will be more convenient to send a formatted using, for example,  low power payload (LPP). See: send-lpp node and https://xod.io/libs/wayland/cayenne-lpp/

@/write-command.description: Send command to LoRaWAN module. Command reference: https://m5stack.oss-cn-shenzhen.aliyuncs.com/resource/docs/datasheet/unit/lorawan/ASR650X%20AT%20Command%20Introduction-20190605.pdf

@/set-freq-mask.description: Set frequency band mask. For example: 0-7 channel has mask of 0001, 8-15 channel has mask of 0002, and so on.

description: Library for the M5Stack LoRa868 module: https://docs.m5stack.com/en/unit/lorawan868. Wraps a modified version of https://github.com/m5stack/M5-LoRaWAN
name: m5stack-unit-lorawan
